definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident

sentences.english: She gets pretty drunk and stumbles home in the wrong direction.
sentences.chinese: 她很醉，跌跌撞撞的回家，卻弄錯了方向。

sentences.english: He stumbled down the stairs like a madman.
sentences.chinese: 他像狂人般地跌跌撞撞地走下了樓。

sentences.english: Going straight with this ridiculous world and stumble over this lonely world, finally they meet at the jail….
sentences.chinese: 在這個荒誕而寂寞的世界中一路前行，跌跌撞撞。

sentences.english: The old man tumbled down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 老人跌跌撞撞地走下樓梯。

sentences.english: He stumbled to the door of the nearest hut and knocked.
sentences.chinese: 他跌跌撞撞來到附近一間草房，敲了敲門。
那個傷兵跌跌撞撞地向前走去。

sentences.english: The boy stumbled out of the room, blind with sleep.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩在半夢半醒之間，跌跌撞撞走出了房間。

sentences.english: An aching back sent me stumbling to the drugstore for relief.
sentences.chinese: 背疼使我跌跌撞撞去藥店減輕痛苦。

sentences.english: Michael watches the crane tumble through the air and flutter into a room below.
sentences.chinese: 看着紙鶴跌跌撞撞地飄到了下面的房間裏。

sentences.english: Her sisters tripped over her legs when they stumbled out of the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 姊姊們從浴室裏跌跌撞撞地跑出來，總被她的腿絆倒。

sentences.english: The drunk tottered down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 那個醉漢跌跌撞撞地走下山。

sentences.english: Then the master stumbled out of the door of the cottage and fell to his knees, weeping helplessly.
sentences.chinese: 然後他跌跌撞撞地走出農舍，跪倒在地，放聲大哭。

sentences.english: He reeled giddily across the room.
sentences.chinese: 他頭暈目眩跌跌撞撞地穿過房內。

sentences.english: He ran to the rear only to bump up against a burning German tank.
sentences.chinese: 他跌跌撞撞跑過一輛燃燒中的德軍坦克，向後方竄去。

sentences.english: I stumbled through mud to a yard strewn with straw.
sentences.chinese: 我跌跌撞撞地趟過泥地來到一個堆滿麥稈的場院。

sentences.english: One night he awoke with diarrhea and stumbled to the public outhouse.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，他被腹瀉弄醒，跌跌撞撞地去外屋公廁。

definition: rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
